Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [knock at Michael's Office door] Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You wanted to see me?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, Oscar come on in. Close the door if you would. Thank you, thanks so much for talking to me.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yeah sure.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm going in for a procedure today.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Is everything okay?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, it's routine. I'm just a little bit scared.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I'm sure everything will be fine. [pulls up a chair] What do you? What's the procedure, if you don't mind my asking?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It is a colonoscopy.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: In your experience, what should I be expecting in terms of sensation or emotions? [Oscar looks irritated and frustrated] Is there anything I can do to make it more pleasurable for me or for Dr. Shaundry?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [sighs] Oh my God.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: My main concern, should I have a safe word?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yeah. [Oscar gets up and walks out]

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: So Michael, do you think you can give me a run down on the Buffalo clients by Monday?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Abso... you know what? I'll do you one better, Sunday, Sunday night.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Okay, I will look at it Monday.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ho, Hol, hold on big guy, I'm gonna put it in the mail Sunday night and you'll get it Weds.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Okay, Jim you wanna hit the conference room?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, Good luck.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh right, this thing. I remember now. [whispers to Jim] What's this about?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ah, this is just me and David, if that's okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's okay with me but he's gonna want me in there.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: No, ah it's okay Michael. We got it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright, do you mind if it sit this out? I have so much work to do, I feel like I'm gonna blow my brains out.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: [nods] Okay. [Jim smiles and waves to Pam]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Am I worried that Jim and David are having a meeting without me? No, because we are the Three Amigos. And once in awhile one of the Amigos will go off... to the bathroom... while the other two have a secret meeting. [shrugs]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey let me escort you to your desk.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay, it's just three or four steps but thank you, thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You and Jim are close, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, I think the pregnancy really brought us together.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, what do you think he and David are talking about? What do you...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ummm, I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, you said good luck to Jim as he walked in.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Did I? Doesn't sound like me, not very superstitious.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: If you are lying to me right now Pam, your baby is gonna come out a liar. That's how it works. They inherit things through the breast milk.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Please don't talk about my breast milk.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I just don't want you to lie to me. I don't want you to ever lie to me. Have I ever lied to you?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I just don't want you to.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I was rushing to fill an order. I put the ladder up to grab a box of three hole from the top shelf. Next thing I know, I'm on the ground and the ladder's on top of me.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: And that's how you broke your ankle?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hmmm, interesting. How did the ladder end up on top of you, if you fell off of it?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: This doesn't concern you man, you need to walk away.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh really, I'm sorry I thought this was a free country. I didn't know we were in communist Sweden.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: If we were living in Sweden, I wouldn't have to worry about this 'cause we'd have universal healthcare.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Nnnnn, that's not... okay.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Be quiet.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm talking about... hmmm.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I will send this off to corporate. Make sure you hold on to your medical bills. Feel better.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Thanks T-Man, later. [fist bumps Toby}

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So long Darryl, feel better... [to Toby] He's lying.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: He has a doctor's note.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh? From who, Dr. J? Look, you really need to investigate this. People don't just fall off of ladders.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: A guy on my street fell off a ladder painting his house. It was on the news.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Since when have you known Darryl to rush to do anything other than to come up here for birthday cake? [imitating Darryl] Y'all having birthday cake?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: That's not a very good Darryl.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Please... and how many foremen do you know that pull boxes?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Hmmm.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It just doesn't add up.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Well, we did a little investigation and Dwight had a good point. The ladder didn't reach the top shelf. I don't know if I believe it, but I am a fan of the hardboiled detective novel. [impression] I'll punch you in da mush, see.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [walks into conference room on his cell phone, interrupting David and Jim] Uh huh, well if he doesn't like it you can tell that SOB that he is fired. Sorry, I'm going into a meeting right now. I will... I love you too. Bye.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Who was that?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sorry about that. What'd I miss?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Michael, we would like to continue the rest of this meeting in private, please, if you don't mind.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do not mind! Yes, I do! No, I don't. Yes, I do! No, I don't mind. Catch you guys on the flippity flop. Oh this... call waiting. [answers his phone] Yeah, uh huh, well you tell the Mayor he just lost six votes.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: [spying on David and Jim] They've been in there a while.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Can't be good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nope.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Think they're talking about me?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, I think they're talking about me.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Yeah, that makes way more sense. Okay thanks boss.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What is Jim telling him? That I can't handle this job? That 's bull crap. That is bull crap. Although, it has been chaotic lately. Corporate shut down the Buffalo branch which left us to absorb all of their clients. I will tell you there has been work everyday. Had to come in on a Saturday. To retrieve... I left my cell phone here.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey Kelly.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Ugh, so jealous of your boobs.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Thank you. Um, listen I just wanted to confirm that you're not coming to the wedding, which is totally understandable and more than fine.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Is Ryan going?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't know, he hasn't RSVP'd yet.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We invited everyone in the office to our wedding. Even though we realized most people wouldn't be able to make the drive to Niagara Falls. [whispers] Which is why we're having it in Niagara Falls. [normal volume] Then Michael told everyone they could have Friday and Monday off, if they came. So now, people have to decide if they want to come to our wedding or have to work.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Here's the deal. I really want to go but I'm not gonna go if Ryan doesn't go, because it's kind of a waste of time. That came out wrong. It would awesome if you could try to get him to go because I'd really like to be there to support Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What can I do for ya Hoss?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [staring into the conference room] How are your sales doin'?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: How are my sales doin'? Busted. My numbers are down a little bit and it's 'cause of the economy. You're not buying it, you're good. Okay the truth is, I have been having trouble focusing lately. I'm in this weird, flirty, nebulous thing with this cousin of mine and it's a total mind effer.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Again with the cousin.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, I'm sorry Phyllis, you explain this email, okay. "Hey Andy let's go visit grandma and then get drunk together, ha ha."

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Shhh, I'm just trying to figure out what's going on in that room, okay?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wallace had to show up on the one four month period that I'm completely overwhelmed.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know when they say it's so crazy it just might work? Well, I don't believe that. I say go for the air-tight plan and that is why I am having Andy wheel me into the conference room inside a makeshift cheese cart. It is just elegant.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [in the cheese cart] Be my eyes.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You got it.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: What have we here?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, just backing up and turning around.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Hey, we're gonna do this...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Dit, dit, dit, dit, it's not for you. [enters the conference room] Pardon moi, Messieurs. I took the liberty of preparing for you a cheese platter which I will place here on the eastern wall of the conference room.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Cheese platter?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oui, Oui, Monsieur. From the Wisconsin region, a nice firm cheddar. Also from the great state of Wisconsin, an aged parmesan. Here you will find a cheddar style spread which has reacted nicely with the air to form a light rind which I think you'll find both challenging and delicious. At that point, I would recommend you take a trip south of the border to the great state of Illinois where you will find this fine Bleu Cheese dressing. If I may be so bold, it's a lot of fun to let the goldfish take a little swim in the bleu cheese. Bon appetit.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Alright, well I should go. Thanks for this. You've given me a lot to think about. Please promise me you won't do anything until we speak.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, I won't. Alright, thanks for giving me your time, I appreciate it.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Thank you Jim.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Erin, is Michael around?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I think he's around here...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [crawls out of the cheese cart unseen] Hey, hey, you must have walked right past me. How you doin'?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Ah, yeah, could we talk in your office for a second?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, definitely.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [spying at Darryl's house] Sounds like a EMDP-40.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Nah, that's a GE. A P40 is much higher pitched.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: You're into trains?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I have been my whole life.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm rebuilding a turn of the century steam engine in my slaughter house.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: That's so cool.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Wow, I'd love to take a look at that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, it's just a run of the mill slaughter house, but sure anytime.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Well, you know, 'cause of the trains.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wa... wa... wait , someone's coming.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Uhh, oh boy, oh boy.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Here, get down! He's not using crutches! Get the camera!

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Get over there! Get over there!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, worker's comp, my ass!

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I can't believe this. [mistaking Darryl's sister for Darryl] Hey you, ass****!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Toby...

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: You gonna eat all that dog food yourself?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ooohhh... [crashes car into garbage cans] Oh man! You okay?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Just keep going.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey Ryan.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So, I just wanted to confirm that you're not coming to my wedding.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah, I might stop by.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It costs about $75 per person.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Okay, I once had a glass of Cognac that cost $77.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Can you just tell me now if you're coming or not?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yes, I'm coming to your wedding.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay, Ryan Howard, yes.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Probably, yes.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Kelly Kapoor, yes.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Are you sure you're okay with these new responsibilites?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Look who you're talking to.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: I'm just trying to figure out the best way to utilize everyone's talents.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well I would say that my greatest talent is being the best man, woman, or child, to have ever run this branch, ever.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: What about Jim? Do you think Jim is someone who is ready to move into a management position?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [looks at Jim] Permission to speak on the record?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Please do.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Jim is like Big Bird. He is tall and yellow and very nice. But would I put him in charge? No, I don't think so. Because Big Bird doesn't make the tough decisions. I... If I was gonna put someone in charge, I would put Burt in charge or I would put one of the real grown-ups in charge, like Maria or Gordon, maybe.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: I thought you liked Jim?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Very much, Jim is my best friend. But it's his performance report... right here. Now this was written by Toby, who we all know is extremely reliable. David: [reading performance report] "Constant office distractions, spends way too much time at reception, antagonizes other salesman, not at all what he thinks he is."

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's not very well written, but you get the gist.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Is there anybody else you think could run the day to day of the branch?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I can just continue to run it myself.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Jim had an interesting idea to help you with this extra work load and it involved you being promoted to oversee all northeast sales and then Jim would be promoted to your position.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This was Jim's idea?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Mmhmm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wow. Ummm, well I'd have to talk to my mother and my guy at H and R Block.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Ummm... okay, here's the thing though. The plan doesn't work unless we have someone to replace you. I was hoping... plus we have to worry about Jim, he has another job offer. We may have to replace him.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I didn't tell Michael because I thought he'd try to help. Example, he handed out Jello shots at the 23rd mile of the Steamtown marathon.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Jim can you walk me out to my car for a second.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [after talking to David, Jim looks dejected] I can't help but feel partially responsible.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [shakes jelly beans] Little pick me up? [Jim accepts] Oh those are the best. Little sugar rush.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: When you were in the office earlier talking to Wallace, did I come up at all?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well we did talk about how handsome you are.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Why don't we head in your office to talk?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh what a week, God. We said... I know there were certain things we said...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Michael, look I'll just be honest with you. Earlier today I spoke with Wallace about a promotion. I actually think that talk went really well. And then after he spoke with you, for some reason it felt like things had changed.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hmmm, that's weird, that's weird... it's kinda weirding me out. Did you know that Lincoln's secretary was named Kennedy.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Michael, did you say anything?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Tell you what, when you leave this office I am going to call Wallace and I am going to tell him that you should get that promotion.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You will? Wanna do it right now?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I tried to keep Michael in the dark. I should have known that he can do just as much damage in the dark.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I need to see your pupils. I need to see if they're dilated.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: If they were dilated...

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Toby! Dwight! Is that them?

Quote.Speaker: Gwenneth
Quote.Text: Definitely.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You come to my house, bust up my trash cans, call my baby sister an ass****, and told her to eat dog food.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: We thought that she was you.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Why would you think a lady is me?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Are you... are you serious? Be... cause you look exactly alike. Am I the only one? Are you getting this?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: No, nah. I don't see it.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Here's what I'm gonna do, I'm calling corporate and I'm filing a complaint against both of you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Aww, Darryl.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: C'mon Gwenneth.

Quote.Speaker: Gwenneth
Quote.Text: Sad.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: [on phone] This is David.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey David, this is Michael Scott. [Jim pushes speaker phone button] Michael Scott here.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Yep.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just wanted to talk to you about Jim Halpert. I understand that he did not receive the promotion. And I wanted to see what I could do to nudge you in the right direction.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: So, what, you're changing your mind about Jim?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Absolutely, [turns speakerphone off] not. [turns speakerphone back on] Like I said before, Jim is fantastic and he deserves this job.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Michael, it seems like you're cutting in and out... This is not what you said earlier.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wha... here's the thing, Jim is the best man for this job, I think you should give it to him.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Well, it doesn't change what you showed me in Jim's file.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, nnnn, that... that was an anomaly. That file had been falsified. Toby Flenderson is doing drugs.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Michael, I really don't know what's going on [police sirens in background] down there, but... oh, dammit, I am getting pulled over for talking on my cell, dammit.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Hey Darryl, look ahhh, we're here to apologize ahh...

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Cool.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wait! They're using the lift as their own personal elevator.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: He broke his ankle climbing over the railing and he lied about it because it was a misuse of company equipment, case closed.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Stupidest thing I've ever heard.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Really? Then why is there new wood only on one railing? Hmmm? We should check the security tapes Toby.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Well, I don't think there's any reason to check 'em but I suppose if we wanted to be really certain...

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Alright, yeah fine so whatever...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: You really did it...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Now, I would like to file an official complaint to corporate because Darryl lied on an official form.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: And I'm telling them you guys sexually harassed my sister.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Phhhht. No judge is gonna believe that...

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Ahhh, kay. Look, we could all file complaints against each other and just drown in a sea of paperwork, but you know, we can just move on with our... with our lives.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: So Dwight and Darryl came to an agreement that both would file complaints with corporate and now I get to do all this paperwork. We worked it out.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, hey Jim, it would make me feel really good right now if you would just punch me in the face. Alright, Just do it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: How many times have I asked you to put me up for a branch manager job.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I never recommended you because I didn't want to lose you and I didn't want to lose Pam, [starts to choke up] and now I don't wanna lose the baby.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So instead, you screwed me?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's what she...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: David Wallace is calling.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Kind of in the middle of something here.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Should I tell him you'll call him back?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I, yeah... no, I'll tell him myself. Let's both.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [on phone] Hello.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Hey Michael, you got Jim there with you?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, it's just us.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Actually, can you call Jim in? I want him on, please.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, oh, well here he is right now. [Michael knocks on desk] Come in. [Makes sound effects for door opening and footsteps and points to Jim to answer]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hi David.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Hey guys, so I spoke to Alan, we had kind of an unconventional idea, which I think is pretty cool. But it only works if everyone's on board.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well just as long as it means Jim becomes a manager.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: We were thinking of having two branch managers in Scranton. Both of you guys working as co-managers. Jim would handle the day to day and Michael you would focus on clients and big picture stuff.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow, that sounds pretty cool.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I like that, so manager and co-manager.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Co-manager and Co-manager. See, there are a lot of moving pieces and this is the only way I can sell it upstairs.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well that might be a little confusing for people because they know me as manager.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Alright, hey Michael can you pick up for one second. [Michael picks up phone] Okay look, I'm not going to force you into anything. If you're willing to lose Jim, fine, you just say so and we'll find another solution, okay. Is that what you want to do?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay people, listen up, I have an announcement to make, fraud was committed...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay everybody, I have an announcement to make... whoa do you have an announcement?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm... I was making it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Everybody, David Wallace and I have talked and we have decided to promote Jim to the position of co-manager.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Co-manager of what?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Of your butt, and your butt, and your butt, all of the Scranton branch butts.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: What's happening to you Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What's happening to me? I am also being promoted to co-manager, we will be co-managers together. Jim Halpert, welcome.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [shakes Michael's hand] Thank you. [Dwight looks disappointed and angry behind them]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: AHHHHHHHHHHHH!

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Niagara Falls in October? Pfft, hells yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Do you think that you could send in your RSVP card?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Nah, I'll just tell you now, easier.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, you have to choose a food option and there's information in there about directions and lodging...

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I'll just have whatever's fanciest, unless there's ribs. I'll just get the other information the day of, I'll text you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You are going to text me, the morning of my wedding.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Uh huh.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: To ask for directions..

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Right...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: And you will eat whatever is fanciest?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Unless there's ribs. [leaves]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Rude.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So rude, right?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Mmm hmmm.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [sits down] Oh my gosh, I have been chasing people down all day. It's incredible.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Pam, my bag was there...
